channel.title: Runescape classic divine PK v5 HELP (.class/.dmk)
channel.description: Hey, using the RSC sprite editor, it seems to modify the sprites, and then compress them into .rscd files, is there any way around this without trashing the entire server? DemonikPKs Source is full of .dmk files and .class files instead... Please, and thanks.

item.title: Runescape classic divine PK v5 HELP (.class/.dmk)
item.dc:creator: @uberpk3r uberpk3r
item.description:
@uberpk3r wrote:

Yes but its all outdated sorry go with EasyRSC or rscd v25, I be glad to help you through it

Read full topic
item.source: Runescape classic divine PK v5 HELP (.class/.dmk)

item.title: Runescape classic divine PK v5 HELP (.class/.dmk)
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

Glathal:

I’ll keep that in mind, Thanks. , but is there any way to read .dmk or .class files with the RSC sprite editor?

my guess, im sure this is how the sprite editer was made, but grab the method in the demonik client that “decodes” or loads the sprites and copy that method in the sprite editor.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape classic divine PK v5 HELP (.class/.dmk)
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“Glathal, post:7, topic:354021”][quote]
or change the EntityHandler to load .rscd. instead of .dmk
[/quote]
Sorry… You guys might have heard me wrong, Demonik, seems to be the easiest running, So i’m using that, the thing is, it has NO RSCD files, instead it has .dmks, and .class files

Upon using the packer with, the .dmk files, it just seemed to crash the server, So… I don’t think the files compatible[/quote]

i get what you’re saying now. your first post was a little sketchy… Demonik is unstable, i would say go with Yong Mins’ Noobscape, its really easy to use. exspecially for beginers.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape classic divine PK v5 HELP (.class/.dmk)
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

uberpk3r:

Ím pretty sure the packer was build for RSCD v25. Otherwise you can simply rename it to “.dmk”

or change the EntityHandler to load .rscd. instead of .dmk

Read full topic
